result.execSummary:
The defendant Johvan M Searcy was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
*Pay DV surcharge plus all other costs and surcharges, including DNA surcharge and restitution if ordered, bail on deposit, if any, to apply; remainder to be paid during the period of probation or a civil judgment will be issued.
*Pay supervision fees.
*Court set restitution at zero.

*NO contact with firearms.
*Due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

*No contact with victim unless approved by the court. Defendant may have 3rd party contact to visit with his children.
*Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order.

*Mental health evaluation; take all prescribed medications.
*Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
*Defendant is to abide by all Family court orders.

*AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
*Maintain absolute sobriety; random urine screens.

records.addlTxt: per remittitur dated October 10, 2017, Appeal Nos. 2016AP001929 CRNM (2015CM001201), and 2016AP001928 (2015CM000905), IT IS ORDERED AND ADJUDGED by this court in a decision filed on May 17, 2017, that:  IT IS ORDERED that the judgments of the circuit court are summarily affirmed pursuant to Wis. Stat. Rule 809.21.  IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that Attorney Gregory Bates is relieved of further representation of Searcy in these matters.

records.addlTxt:
15A 041470

Note: Cash bond reapplied correctly (Ref. 15A041462)

Defendant Johvan M Searcy in court with attorney Thomas K. Hackbart.  Patrick D. Winter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
As to both counts:
  Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.  

Court sentenced the defendant to serve 7 months in the House of Correction, as to each count.  Sentences are concurrent with each other but consecutive to any other sentence, including case 15CM0905,  with credit for -0-days served. 
 Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 2 years, concurrent,  with the following conditions:

- Mental health evaluation; take all prescribed medications.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety; random urine screens.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- No contact with victim unless approved by the court.
  Defendant may have 3rd party contact to visit with his children.
- Defendant is to abide by all Family court orders.
- No contact with firearms.
- Pay DV surcharge plus all other costs and surcharges, including DNA surcharge and restitution if ordered, bail on deposit, if any, to apply; remainder to be paid during the period of probation or a civil judgment will be issued.
- Pay supervision fees.
- Court set restitution at zero.
 
Received and filed: 
Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation. 
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

Attorney Thomas K. Hackbart in court.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
E-mail received and filed.
Defense counsel informed the court that the defendant is in an in-patient in a mental health unit.  The court issued but stayed a bench warrant until the next court date in Branch 36.

  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Johvan M Searcy in court with attorney Thomas K. Hackbart.  Patrick D. Winter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
 Opening statements made by the state and the defense. Trial proceeded.  
Court ordered the witnesses sequestered.
Sworn for the state: Veronica P.  Exhibits 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, and 6 received.  Sworn for the State: Ella Cathey.   State rests subject to rebuttal. 
Defendant does not wish to testify.  The court questioned the defendant and found that he freely, voluntarily and knowingly waived his right to testify. Defense rests.  State and defense rest.  Testimony closed.  
Defense motion to dismiss at close of evidence argued and denied by the court.  Closing arguments by state and defense.  
The court found that the defendant is GUILTY of the charge of Bail Jumping and Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction, counts 1 and 2 of the criminal complaint.
Statement by the victim to the court about additional contact from the defendant.
.
Case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 36.
.
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 3, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Johvan M Searcy in court with attorney Thomas K. Hackbart.  Patrick D. Winter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Defendant wants to go to trial.  Case passed to allow the defendant to speak to his attorney.
.
Defendant wants to waive his jury trial.  Court questioned the defendant as to his waiver.  The court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his right to a jury trial.  Waiver received and filed.
Court will start this case at 1:30 p.m.
.

.

All conditions, including Justice Point remain.

Defendant Johvan M Searcy in court with attorney Thomas K. Hackbart.  Defendant Johvan M Searcy in custody.  Owen Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Return of Doctor's Report. Court reviewed report. Defendant is competent to proceed. Parties do not contest the findings. Court reinstated proceedings and bail including any conditions.   Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502.  Case set for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial.   Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Received & Filed, Wisconsin Forensic Unit Report.

Defendant Johvan M Searcy in court with attorney Thomas K. Hackbart.  Defendant Johvan M Searcy in custody.  Owen Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Andrew Golden appeared on behalf of the victim. Case set for Final Pretrial Conference.  Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit. Proceedings ordered suspended.  Order for Examination, signed and filed. Court ordered defendant REMANDED into custody of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department. Court VACATED a Jury Trial date. Court resided all of defendant's mail privileges, but allows for telephone and in person contact with his Mother, Attorney Hackbart and Attorney Nancy Morris ONLY.  Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502. Case set for a return of doctor's report in branch 23.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for July 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Thomas K. Hackbart in court, defendant Johvan M Searcy not in court, in custody.  Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant NOT produced. Case set for Status Conference. State's motion to join 14CM4989, 15CM905 & 15CM1201 for Jury Trial, GRANTED.  Defense counsel requests case be set for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial. Case adjourned for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial to branch 23.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 4, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for June 15, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Veronica P

Defendant Johvan M Searcy in court with attorney Gabriela A Leija.  Defendant Johvan M Searcy in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Status conference scheduled for May 27, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
